channel.title: Swiss woman attempts to live with only sunlight; dies
channel.description:
Swiss newspaper Tages-Anzeiger reports that a woman starved to death after embarking on a spiritual diet that required her to stop eating or drinking and live off sunlight alone. The Zurich newspaper reported Wednesday that the unnamed Swiss woman in her fifties decided to follow the radical fast in 2010 after viewing an Austrian documentary about an Indian guru who claims to have lived this way for 70 years. Tages-Anzeiger says there have been similar cases of self-starvation in Germany, Britain and Australia. The prosecutors' office in the Swiss canton (state) of Aargau confirmed Wednesday that the woman died in January 2011 in the town of Wolfhalden in eastern Switzerland. Read more: http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/swiss-women-dies-giving-water-food-thought-live-sunlight-article-1.1067359#ixzz1tAwHUlT1
http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/swiss-women-dies-giving-water-food-thought-live-sunlight-article-1.1067359 you fucking kidding me

@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Yume, post:17, topic:440706”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=543378.msg3986393#msg3986393 date=1335926262]

I do wonder how much energy our bodies obtain from the sun directly. (if any)

As I recall you absorb your daily dosage of vitamin D and radiation in about 10 minutes of direct sunlight anything past that is a waste and cancerous.
[/quote]

How is that for higher latitudes where there is “less” sunlight (I assume) ?[/quote]

then they use uv lights/tanning machines, true story

ps artic circle, the sun doesn’t rise for most months and for the rest of the year the sun doesn’t set

ps if you’re black then the further north you go the iller affects you suffer from lack of sunlight

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Speljohan:

westeners all drink bull urine (Taurine, found in most if not all energy drinks).

Uh, no? Did you mean bull bile instead of urine? The wikipedia page mentions nothing of urine, though it’s found in the bile of many mammals. Also, most if not all of Taurine in energy drinks and man-made things is synthetically produced.
